assemblyInfo.assemblyMethod: TrioCanu v. 1.8; purge_dups v. 1.0.0; Scaff 10x v. 4.1.0; Bionano solve v. 3.2.1_04122018; Salsa2 HiC v. 2.2; Arrow polishing and gap filling v. SMRTLink7.0.1; Freebayes v. 1.3.1; gEVAL manual curation v. 2020-07-22; VGP trio assembly pipeline v. 1.6

bioprojects.title: Gallus gallus (Chicken) genome, bGalGal1, maternal haplotype (broiler, GRC7b)

attributes.name: breed
attributes.value: Cross of Broiler mother + white leghorn layer father

biosample.breed: Cross of Broiler mother + white leghorn layer father

description.comment: The chicken has been the most studied bird. It serves as a model organism for basic and biomedical science, and is one of the most commonly consumed food sources for humans. This trio of samples was collected to create a high-quality reference genome for two haplotypes. The female offspring (bGalGal1) is a cross between a modern broiler breeder mother (bGalGal2) and white Leghorn father (bGalGal3). Breeding and sample collection was conducted by Nick Anthony at the University of Arkansas, in coordination with Wesley Warren, Ron Okimoto, Hans Cheng, and Rachel Hawken. Blood from these samples were used to create high-quality reference genome assemblies of each haplotype, coordinated by Erich Jarvis, Wesley Warren, and Olivier Fedrigo, at the Rockefeller University Vertebrate Genome Lab, as part of the Vertebrate Genomes Project (VGP) and the Genome Reference Consortium (GRC).
description.title: Animal sample from Gallus gallus (bGalGal3)

sampleIds.label: Sample name
sampleIds.value: Chicken sample for VGP-GRC reference genome child of trio

assemblyInfo.sequencingTech: PacBio Sequel I CLR; Illumina NovaSeq; Arima Genomics Hi-C; Bionano Genomics DLS
